meta.title: Vais - AI-Optimized Systems Programming Language
meta.description: Vais is a token-efficient systems programming language designed for AI code generation with native LLVM performance.

hero.title:
Write fewer tokens,
get native performance
hero.subtitle: Vais (Vibe AI Language for Systems) is a systems programming language optimized for AI code generation. Single-character keywords, expression-oriented syntax, and LLVM-powered native speed.

compare.title: Token Efficiency Matters
compare.subtitle: AI models pay per token. Vais uses 33% fewer tokens than Rust and 40% fewer than C for equivalent programs — single-char keywords, expression bodies, and auto-return add up across codebases.
compare.barNote: fibonacci + quicksort + http_types + linked_list (tiktoken cl100k_base). See benchmarks.

performance.title: Native Performance
performance.subtitle: Vais compiles to optimized LLVM IR — on par with C and Rust at runtime, with fast compilation.
performance.compileNote: Vais --emit-ir vs full compilation. 8.6x faster than C, 19x faster than Rust. Updated 2026-02-11.

features.title: Why Vais?
features.subtitle: Designed from the ground up for AI-assisted development without sacrificing performance.

singleChar.title: Single-Char Keywords
singleChar.description: F for function, S for struct, I/E for if/else, L for loop, M for match. Minimal tokens, maximum clarity.

selfRecursion.title: Self-Recursion Operator
selfRecursion.description: The @ operator calls the current function recursively. No need to repeat the function name — AI-friendly and concise.

expression.title: Everything is an Expression
expression.description: If/else, match, and blocks all return values. No return keyword needed for the last expression. Functional and ergonomic.

llvm.title: LLVM Native Speed
llvm.description: Compiles to optimized native code via LLVM. Get C-level performance with high-level ergonomics. Supports LTO and PGO.

inference.title: Type Inference
inference.description: Bidirectional type checking infers types automatically. Write x := 42 instead of explicit type annotations everywhere.

toolchain.title: Full Toolchain
toolchain.description: LSP server, formatter, debugger, REPL, package manager, and IDE plugins for VSCode and IntelliJ. Production-ready tooling.

multiTarget.title: Multi-Target Output
multiTarget.description: Compile to native binaries, WebAssembly, or JavaScript. Run Vais code in the browser with full WASM interop and JS codegen.

incremental.title: Incremental Compilation
incremental.description: Per-module caching with parallel codegen. Recompile only what changed — 30K-line projects rebuild in under 100ms.

selfHosting.title: Self-Hosting Compiler
selfHosting.description: Vais can compile itself. The self-hosting compiler achieves bootstrap with 50,000+ lines of Vais, backed by 520 E2E tests and 2,500+ total tests.

playground.title: Try Vais Now
playground.subtitle: Write and run Vais code directly in your browser. No installation required.

install.title: Get Started in Seconds
install.oneClickNote: Detects your OS & arch automatically. macOS, Linux, WSL.
